docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Margaret F. C. Chan, an expert on SARS and avian influenza, was nominated yesterday by the executive board of the World Health Organization to be the agency's director general. She is expected to be elected today by a special session of the organization, an agency of the United Nations based in Geneva. If elected, Dr. Chan, Hong Kong's former health director, will become the first person from China to lead a United Nations agency, a United Nations spokesman said.

headline.main: Hong Kong Doctor Nominated to Lead W.H.O.

docs.abstract: Dr Margaret F C Chan, expert on SARS and avian influenza, is nominated by executive board of World Health Organization to be agency's director general; she is expected to be elected by special session of WHO, an agency of United Nations based in Geneva; if elected, she will become first person from China to lead a United Nations agency; she would fill vacancy left by death of Dr Lee Jong-wook of South Korea last May; photo (M)
